text: In this video,

we will show you how to
start breeding flowers
in Animal Crossing: New Horizons.
To start, flowers need to be planted
next to another flower of the same kind
to crossbreed correctly.
For example, windflowers will only breed
with other windflowers.
A good practice is to separate
your different breedings using fences
so the flowers don't grow out of control
and breed in ways you don't plan.

Water your plants, and
after a few days in-game,
you should see the results.
You can also breed your hybrid flowers
with other hybrid flowers of the same kind
for more combinations.
Pay attention to how flowers are produced,
as some hybrid flowers will look
like their normal counterparts,
such as the hybrid red flower.
Remember where you planted your original
normal flowers to avoid a mix-up.

Keep in mind that multiple
attempts at breeding
may be needed for certain hybrids as well.

Breeding flowers in Animal
Crossing have different

chances of success depending
on the flowers used,

so you may not get the
flower you want immediately.
For the best result when breeding,
use flower seeds rather than flowers
found naturally on the island.

The only exception would
be when breeding flowers
found on rare islands.

Flower seeds can be obtained
easily from Nook's Cranny.

For a specific hybrid, we
linked to a comprehensive chart
created by Animal Crossing data miners

in the description below to
understand how to produce it.
